website_summaries.verdict: Outdoor enthusiasts who are in need of a hiker that offers great amounts of comfort may find one in the Chaco Z/Canyon 2. Those who would choose to invest in this product are also likely to brag about its glove-like fit, incredible surface traction, and flexible midsole. It is a sandal for virtually everyone, although access to its many qualities is locked behind a rather lengthy softening stage. Nevertheless, the Z/Canyon 2 from Chaco revels in its remarkable traits.
pros: Many reviewers, including professional ones, applaud the Chaco Z/Canyon 2’s extreme comfiness
Footwear pundits are quite smitten by the hiker’s astonishing grip performance over different types of terrain
This sandal-type hiking footgear has floored bloggers with its amazingly flexible midsole
Some owners find their Z/Canyon 2s great-fitting
Its lightness has floored a few testers, which include a shoe critic by profession
This Chaco product impresses less than a handful of users with its exceptional arch support
The Chaco Z/Canyon 2 is praised by a couple of patrons for being a sight to behold
Someone who reviews footwear for a living commended the sandal’s ability to keep the heel in place
cons: Its rather long break-in period has disappointed an expert

customer_reviews.title: Beware, the back heel strap is much thicker...feels less durable.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the weight(much lighter) compared to my old chacos. However, the heel strap is the main point of concern and low rating. It has padding on the inside, which as first was nice but then i developed pressure point blisters on the sides of both feet. Never happened in my old Z/2's. Also, the side piece of the heel strap that goes down to the heel, seems like it'll break much sooner. the glue has already come undone a little from the top of the sole. And i've only worn them for 2 whole day!!! Giving it two stars because they're light and as always, love to cloud footbed/sole
customer_reviews.author: towll

customer_reviews.title: Not good for me.
customer_reviews.text: First pair of Chaco's were Z Cloud so I have that as comparison. The Z Cloud sole bed is just softer and more comfortable as the day wears on. The rigid ankle portion on the Canyon is what really makes them start to be uncomfortable though. That and the straps have significantly less play to be adjusted for comfort. I didn't get to try these on so that was my mistake. I thought the Z Cloud was going to let me know what these were like but the differences are more pronounced than I expected. Try before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Blisters!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Chaco flip flops so I decided to buy my first pair of Chaco sandals. I’ve worn them three times so far and this new rubber heel cup they’ve created is delivering nothing but blisters. If the comfort doesn’t improve over time, then I’ll be requesting an exchange for one of their classic, proven models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, aggressive arch took a while to get used to but enjoy now, good quality. Think they are overpriced, but I bought these based on a recommendation from daughter without any recent sandal experience other than slides.
customer_reviews.author: gdb

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love them but couldn't
customer_reviews.text: Sadly these fell short on the chaco comfort scale.. the tpu heel cup doesn't offer the same flexibility of the cloth straps. The foot bed rebound plate was good and the sandals were considerably lighter than classics. Returned for z cloud 2.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Julian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice sandals
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my dad who needed a lightweight open sandals with a back strap. They work good, but he has a little trouble getting his toe in the toe trap cause the tightness moves when you pull on them. Otherwise they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: favorite pair
customer_reviews.text: I own three other pairs of Chaco's, one pair with a toe loop. These have become my favorite. Comfortable and supportive. Only concern is the possible longevity of the heel strap. It is a rubber like material and wonder how it will last. Other Chaco's, the strap is their sturdy textile material.
customer_reviews.author: senior

customer_reviews.title: Chaco sandals
customer_reviews.text: Im personally a fan of the chaco brand. Yes, they are heavier and thicker for a sandal. But these things last a long long time. I now own them with and without the big toe hold. I prefer them with
customer_reviews.author: MrPenguin

customer_reviews.title: Heel strap—more like hell strap
customer_reviews.text: How am I supposed to break these in when I get blisters from the rubber heel strap after only walking like 100 m. I know a lot of people who've loved their chacos, but I have to assume they didn't get this model. Don't get these unless you plan on always wearing socks with your sandals like some kind of weirdo. The heel strap is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Faber

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Definitely go up a size if you wear a half size! Once you get past the Initial blistering they are great
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Chacos I’ve loved for YEARS!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn Chacos for years and have loved them but unfortunately now they have changed the design. Instead of webbing everywhere, now there’s a big rubber section around the heel which not only adds weight but it rubs so badly that I now have to apply moleskin just to wear them. Very disappointed! Why couldn’t they leave a perfect design well enough alone?
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Tyson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Sandal
customer_reviews.text: These sandals hold up in all weather. They are definitely comfortable for all day use. I have yet to have any issues with blisters as others have. Maybe it because I take care of my feet. Lotion, Vasaline & a sock (at night) works wonders. Not judgin', just sayin'.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Slippery when wet.
customer_reviews.text: It a great sandal. It’s pretty slippery when it’s raining or wet so be mindful of that. No blisters at all, it fits great. The straps can be long enough that it may touch the ground if you have pretty slim feet. I would definitely recommend for going around campus. It’s pretty rugged and feels like it’ll last a long time, hiking with it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for planters fasciitis!
customer_reviews.text: Love Chacos. These look good , feel good and work great. No slip, use for water and hiking. Orthopaedic too!
customer_reviews.author: SweetMoon

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend to a friend
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable to walk in no raw ankles like some of the other reviews said great sandals
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: These sandals are the best - I love them
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are the best - I love them ! My wife raved about hers and I finally got a pair . Love the foot cradle of the sandal .
customer_reviews.author: Joee

customer_reviews.title: Great river sandals.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and decent traction in the river. I live on a rocky river in VT and these are must haves! The toe strap took a minute to get used to but now I'm a convert. These are hands down the most comfortable and secure feeling sandals I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Ben E. Coyote

customer_reviews.title: comfortable sandle
customer_reviews.text: great for the summer. comfortable for walking and being on a beach.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sandals
customer_reviews.text: You'll love these sandals they're the best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: nryan

customer_reviews.title: Painful blisters
customer_reviews.text: Love the way they look but they tend to rub below the ball of my ankle and give painful blisters. It’s where fabric meets the rubber. Maybe if it was all fabric I would not have had this problem.
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love my Canyon 2's. Only take them off to swim and go to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Mahana

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I literally have worn them everyday for 4 months and don't plan on stopping soon. I love my chacos
customer_reviews.author: Christian C

customer_reviews.title: Wide foot. Story time not clickbait
customer_reviews.text: If you have wide feet size up a whole size. Toe strap is comfy and they have a great feeling being thag theyre brand new and not broken in yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Montes-lopez

customer_reviews.title: toe straps slips
customer_reviews.text: toe strap kinda slips off while swimming but other than that they are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Edward M.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable - all day sandal for a variety of activities!
customer_reviews.text: Great sole, arch and straps that are comfortable! Seems very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff from Florida

customer_reviews.title: Sandals for life
customer_reviews.text: I got the sandals back in may. I love wearing them everywhere. They are great to hike in, take a walk in, wear all day. I have noticed a small tear in the sole after a few months of good use. Also the rubber heal gave me blister the first few times wearing them. But overall I love these sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Phillips

product_meta.title: Chaco - Men's Zcanyon 2
product_meta.description: The Z/Canyon takes the whitewater inspired design of the original Z/Sandal and upgrades the performance potential. A running-inspired, kinetic rebound plate captures and returns energy with every step while the innovative, dual-density 3-D Heel Holster locks in performance. Newly formulated ChacoGrip+ outsole leverages toe and heel pods to level up traction and our new, Cloud 2.0 midsole use bio-targeted support for active cushioning. As always, Chaco’s standard pass through webbing straps create a custom fit no matter the foot. All in all, it’s Chaco’s most performance-ready package to date. UPPER: Polyester jacquard webbing upper wraps around the foot and through the midsole for a customized fit Toe loop for secure fit 3D molded TPU Heel Holster for secure fit Injection-molded ladder lock buckle MIDSOLE: Men's specific LUVSEAT dual-density PU midsole Running-inspired Kinetic Rebound plate Cloud 2.0 midsole with bio-targeted support for active cushioning OUTSOLE: Non-marking ChacoGrip Plus rubber compound
feature_bullets: Polyester jacquard webbing upper wraps around the foot and through the midsole for a customized fit toe loop for secure fit 3D molded TPU heel holster for secure fit injection-molded ladder lock buckle
Men's specific LUVSEAT dual-density PU midsole running-inspired Kinetic rebound plate Cloud 2.0 Midsole with bio-targeted support for active cushioning
